thread.title: Lynch mob drags woman accused of killing toddler from prison cell then throws her on a BONFIRE
thread.title_full: Lynch mob drags woman accused of killing toddler from prison cell then throws her on a BONFIRE

author: Natalie Evans
title: Lynch mob drags woman accused of killing toddler from prison cell then throws her on a BONFIRE

organizations.name: special rescue and assault task force

text:
News Lynch mob drags woman accused of killing toddler from prison cell then throws her on a BONFIRE WARNING GRAPHIC IMAGES: The angry mob broke down the doors of the police station where the suspected arsonist was being held and attacked her Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
This is the horrific moment a furious mob lynched a suspected arsonist being held in police cells - before throwing her onto a BONFIRE. 
The 30-year-old woman was being held on suspicion of causing a fire that killed a two-year-old boy in Novo Aripuana, Brazil, on Monday. 
A baying mob of around 500 residents stormed the police station and broke down the doors of the holding cell before dragging her outside on Tuesday afternoon. 
Locals torched impounded cars to start a make-shift bonfire and pulled the woman by the HAIR onto the roaring flames. Read More The mob surrounded the police station (Photo: Viral Press / PolÃ­cia Militar) The woman was dragged from her cell and chased (Photo: Viral Press / PolÃ­cia Militar) 
Police called for military reinforcements to hold back the mob before the injured woman could be saved and taken to hospital. 
They are now reviewing footage of the incident to identify those involved - and have appealed for help finding the attackers seen on the clip. The suspect was captured by the lynch mob (Photo: Viral Press / PolÃ­cia Militar) She was surrounded and attacked by the gang (Photo: Viral Press / PolÃ­cia Militar) 
Amazonas Civil Police said in a statement: ''Police reinforcement arrived following the events of this Tuesday. 
''The Civil Police requested reinforcements from the Military Police Command (CPM), which sent a troop of full military police in Borba, a municipality 151 km away from the capital, and eight other police officers of the Command Special Police (CPE) of Manaus, by means of a chartered aircraft. Read More The mob then threw the woman onto the bonfire (Photo: Viral Press / PolÃ­cia Militar) Her hair caught fire (Photo: Viral Press / PolÃ­cia Militar) 
''On Wednesday members of the Special Rescue and Assault Task Force (Fera) and an expert from the Institute of Criminalistics (IC) began an investigation into the event.'' 
The lynched woman had been arrested on Monday on suspicion of breaking into and setting fire to a house in which there were seven people inside including three children. The suspected arsonist was set on fire (Photo: Viral Press / PolÃ­cia Militar) The bloodied woman was then dragged from the flames (Photo: Viral Press / PolÃ­cia Militar) 
A two year-old boy was burned alive in the fire, causing fury among locals. 
The woman had been questioned but had not yet been charged before the locals rampaged through the 73rd Interactive Police Department building to find her. Read More Police held the mob back to reach the woman (Photo: Viral Press / PolÃ­cia Militar) The woman was seen burnt and bloodied after the attack (Photo: Viral Press / PolÃ­cia Militar) 
Civil Police said that the suspect had been taken to hospital to receive treatment and would be returned to a new police station with a secret location to avoid further attacks before questioning over the first incident could resume. Like us on Facebook
